headline: KB Home, First Solar, Nextracker, SmartRent, and Boise Cascade Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks fell in the morning session after an unexpectedly sharp rise in wholesale inflation fueled concerns about rising costs and their impact on corporate profits. The primary catalyst was the July 2025 Producer Price Index (PPI), a measure of inflation at the wholesale level, which jumped 0.9% against forecasts of a 0.2% rise. This represents the most significant monthly increase in over three years, pointing to mounting cost pressures for manufacturers, with tariffs cited as a key

headline: QCLN: High Valuations In The Clean Tech Rally
summary: QCLN offers growth in semiconductors and EVs but faces valuation concerns and underperformance vs. peers. See why CNRG may be a better choice.

headline: Energy Transition Today - Streetleaf Expands Team to Boost Sustainable Infrastructure Nationwide
summary: Streetleaf, a prominent provider of solar-powered streetlighting services in the U.S., is continuing to strengthen its operations by appointing Brandy Potter and Kristen Proud as new Account Managers to serve customers in Texas and Florida. These appointments aim to enhance Streetleaf's customer service and support its mission to advance sustainable infrastructure across communities nationwide. Through the growth of its expert team, the company seeks to accelerate the transition to renewable...
